Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='YP93')

BibliographicData.Title: Striatal connections of the parietal association cortices in rhesus monkeys

Reference.Quotation: " Grains were distributed in distinct clusters along the diagonal axis, extending from the dorsomedial to the central-lateral portion of the putamen. At the rostral most level of the putamen, grains were distributed in a central and lateral location. Caudally in the putamen grains were distributed dorsally and medially.Some label was also noted in the lateral most sector of the head and of the body of the caudate nucleus,..."

" Grains were distributed in distinct clusters along the diagonal axis, extending from the dorsomedial to the central-lateral portion of the putamen. At the rostral most level of the putamen, grains were distributed in a central and lateral location. Caudally in the putamen grains were distributed dorsally and medially.Some label was also noted in the lateral most sector of the head and of the body of the caudate nucleus,..."

"...label was located mainly in the dorsal and lateral portion of hte head and the body of the caudate nucleus. Caudally in hte body, grains were found more medially. Sparse clusters of grains were noted in the dorsal part of the genu of hte cuadte nucleus, as well as medially in hte caudal portion of the tail."
